title: 79/308. Financing of the United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon

paragraphs.1: Requests the Secretary-General to entrust the Head of Mission with the task of formulating future budget proposals in full accordance with the provisions of its resolutions 59/296 of 22 June 2005, 60/266 of 30 June 2006, 61/276 of 29 June 2007, 64/269 of 24 June 2010, 65/289 of 30 June 2011, 66/264 of 21 June 2012, 69/307 of 25 June 2015, 70/286 of 17 June 2016 and 76/274 of 29 June 2022, as well as other relevant resolutions;
paragraphs.2: Takes note of the status of contributions to the United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon as at 30 April 2025, including the contributions outstanding in the amount of 203.8 million United States dollars, representing some 1.6 per cent of the total assessed contributions, notes with concern that only 88 Member States have paid their assessed contributions in full, and urges all other Member States, in particular those in arrears, to ensure payment of their outstanding assessed contributions;
paragraphs.3: Expresses its appreciation to those Member States that have paid their assessed contributions in full, and urges all other Member States to make every possible effort to ensure payment of their assessed contributions to the Force in full;
paragraphs.6: Expresses concern at the financial situation with regard to peacekeeping activities, in particular as regards the reimbursements to troop contributors that bear additional burdens owing to overdue payments by Member States of their assessments;
paragraphs.7: Emphasizes that all future and existing peacekeeping missions shall be given equal and non-discriminatory treatment in respect of financial and administrative arrangements;
paragraphs.8: Also emphasizes that all peacekeeping missions shall be provided with adequate resources for the effective and efficient discharge of their respective mandates;
paragraphs.10: Endorses the conclusions and recommendations contained in the report of the Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions, subject to the provisions of the present resolution, and requests the Secretary-General to ensure their full implementation;
paragraphs.11: Decides to abolish the post of Finance and Budget Officer (Field Service) in the Finance and Budget Management Section that has been vacant for more than 24 months;
paragraphs.12: Requests the Secretary-General to ensure the full implementation of the relevant provisions of its resolutions 59/296, 60/266, 61/276, 64/269, 65/289, 66/264, 69/307, 70/286 and 76/274;
paragraphs.13: Also requests the Secretary-General to take all action necessary to ensure that the Force is administered with a maximum of efficiency and economy;
paragraphs.14: Reiterates its request to the Secretary-General to take the measures necessary to ensure the full implementation of paragraph 8 of resolution 51/233, paragraph 5 of resolution 52/237, paragraph 11 of resolution 53/227, paragraph 14 of resolution 54/267, paragraph 14 of resolution 55/180 A, paragraph 15 of resolution 55/180 B, paragraph 13 of resolution 56/214 A, paragraph 13 of resolution 56/214 B, paragraph 14 of resolution 57/325, paragraph 13 of resolution 58/307, paragraph 13 of resolution 59/307, paragraph 17 of resolution 60/278, paragraph 21 of resolution 61/250 A, paragraph 20 of resolution 61/250 B, paragraph 20 of resolution 61/250 C, paragraph 21 of resolution 62/265, paragraph 19 of resolution 63/298, paragraph 18 of resolution 64/282, paragraph 15 of resolution 65/303, paragraph 13 of resolution 66/277, paragraph 13 of resolution 67/279, paragraph 13 of resolution 68/292, paragraph 14 of resolution 69/302, paragraph 13 of resolution 70/280, paragraph 14 of resolution 71/307, paragraph 14 of resolution 72/299, paragraph 16 of resolution 73/322, paragraph 3 of resolution 75/250 A, paragraph 39 of resolution 75/250 B, paragraph 15 of resolution 76/290, paragraph 14 of resolution 77/313 and paragraph 13 of resolution 78/305, stresses once again that Israel shall pay the amount of 1,117,005 dollars resulting from the incident at Qana on 18 April 1996, and requests the Secretary-General to report on this matter to the General Assembly at its eightieth session; Budget performance report for the period from 1 July 2023 to 30 June 2024
paragraphs.15: Takes note of the report of the Secretary-General on the budget performance of the Force for the period from 1 July 2023 to 30 June 2024; 3 Budget estimates for the period from 1 July 2025 to 30 June 2026
paragraphs.16: Decides to appropriate to the special account for the United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon the amount of 605,340,200 dollars for the period from 1 July 2025 to 30 June 2026, inclusive of 552,841,800 dollars for the maintenance of the Force, 46,093,700 dollars for the support account for peacekeeping operations and 6,404,700 dollars for the United Nations Logistics Base at Brindisi, Italy; Financing of the appropriation for the period from 1 July 2025 to 30 June 2026
paragraphs.17: Decides to apportion among Member States the amount of 100,890,000 dollars for the period from 1 July to 31 August 2025 in accordance with the levels updated in its resolution 79/250 of 24 December 2024, taking into account the scale of assessments for 2025, as set out in its resolution 79/249 of 24 December 2024;
paragraphs.18: Also decides that, in accordance with the provisions of its resolution 973 (X) of 15 December 1955, there shall be set off against the apportionment among Member States, as provided for in paragraph 17 above, their respective share in the Tax Equalization Fund of 4,075,900 dollars, comprising the estimated staff assessment income of 3,248,400 dollars approved for the Force, the prorated share of 705,800 dollars of the estimated staff assessment income approved for the support account and the prorated share of 121,700 dollars of the estimated staff assessment income approved for the United Nations Logistics Base;
paragraphs.19: Further decides to apportion among Member States the amount of 504,450,200 dollars for the period from 1 September 2025 to 30 June 2026, at a monthly rate of 50,445,020 dollars, in accordance with the levels updated in its resolution 79/250, taking into account the scale of assessments for 2025 and 2026, as set out in its resolution 79/249, subject to a decision of the Security Council to extend the mandate of the Force;
paragraphs.20: Decides that, in accordance with the provisions of its resolution 973 (X), there shall be set off against the apportionment among Member States, as provided for in paragraph 19 above, their respective share in the Tax Equalization Fund of 20,379,800 dollars, comprising the estimated staff assessment income of 16,242,000 dollars approved for the Force, the prorated share of 3,529,200 dollars of the estimated staff assessment income approved for the support account and the prorated share of 608,600 dollars of the estimated staff assessment income approved for the United Nations Logistics Base;
paragraphs.21: Also decides that, for Member States that have fulfilled their financial obligations to the Force, there shall be set off against the apportionment, as provided for in paragraphs 17 and 19 above, their respective share of the unencumbered balance and other revenue in the amount of 43,469,400 dollars in respect of the financial period ended 30 June 2024, in accordance with the levels updated in its resolution 76/239 of 24 December 2021, taking into account the scale of assessments for 2024, as set out in its resolution 76/238 of 24 December 2021;
paragraphs.22: Further decides that, for Member States that have not fulfilled their financial obligations to the Force, there shall be set off against their outstanding obligations their respective share of the unencumbered balance and other revenue in the total amount of 43,469,400 dollars in respect of the financial period ended 30 June 2024, in accordance with the scheme set out in paragraph 21 above;
paragraphs.23: Decides that the decrease of 253,000 dollars in the estimated staff assessment income in respect of the financial period ended 30 June 2024 shall be set off against the credits in the amount of 43,469,400 dollars referred to in paragraphs 21 and 22 above;
paragraphs.24: Encourages the Secretary-General to continue to take additional measures to ensure the safety and security of all personnel participating in the Force under the auspices of the United Nations, bearing in mind paragraphs 5 and 6 of Security Council resolution 1502 (2003) of 26 August 2003;
paragraphs.26: Decides to include in the provisional agenda of its eightieth session, under the item entitled “Financing of the United Nations peacekeeping forces in the Middle East”, the sub-item entitled “United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon”.
